It's finally here. Q* rings true. Tiny LLMs are as good at math as a frontier model.  By using the same techniques Google used to solve Go (MTCS and backprop), Llama8B gets 96.7% on math benchmark GSM8K!  That’s better than GPT-4, Claude and Gemini, with 200x less parameters!

Oldies but goldies: Cooley, James W.; Tukey, John W., An algorithm for the machine calculation of complex Fourier series, 1965. Showed how to compute the discrete Fourier transform in n*log(n) operations. Used (almost) everywhere. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_Fourier_transform

In this context, "cost" does *not* mean "monetary cost." It is used in the technical sense of "cost function" : a scalar-valued mathematical function that takes large values for bad things, low values for good things, and zero for ideally good things.

Did you know that MRI machines sequentially samples responses of body tissue to a range of radio frequencies. This is why MRI is so slow -- brain scans can take upto an hour.    Our new @icmlconf paper shows that RL can make  scanning ~12x faster by selecting the RF to scan. 👇

Integrating a flow field defines a diffeomorphism (warping) of the space. Smooth vector fields are, in some sense, the tangent space of diffeomorphisms. If you haven't yet, please read this full thread.   @deanwball does a great job showing how poorly the bill holds up to scrutiny, and how recent revisions don't address major concerns.  Despite what Weiner and Dan claim, they are simply ignoring our feedback.

The reality is that the critics of this bill are wildly bipartisan, ranging from socialists to Randians. Substantively, Senator Wiener’s amendments do not alleviate that group’s concerns. SB 1047 is still incompatible with open source, and still harms California’s AI industry.

“Imagine if we passed a law that says if anyone uses a motor in a harmful way, the *motor manufacturer* is liable.”  This would be ridiculous. Well that is what California’s SB-1047 is proposing for AI models.  Regulate the application. Not the math.

The cepstrum of a time series is the inverse Fourier transform of the log of the Fourier transform. Used to detect fundamental frequency in sound processing and is a useful feature for audio signal discrimination. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cepstrum https://www.johndcook.com/blog/2016/05/18/cepstrum-quefrency-and-pitch/
